member.summary: Gets the number of items in Buffer.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the RasterCodecs.TagFound event.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which allows the user to abort the enumeration process.
member.value: true to abort the enumeration process, false to continue normally.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements.
member.value: The number of elements of type MetadataType. Note that this is not the same as the number of bytes. For example, if Countis 10 and MetadataType is RasterTagMetadataDataType.Int32, you will need 10 x 4 = 40 bytes to read the tag data

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.Id
member.summary: Gets the tag id.
member.value: Tag to identify the data in the TIFF file. This may be any tag specified in RasterCodecs.WriteTag, or any other tag added by the TIFF filter when saving the file. For example, all of the TIFF comments would generate a particular TIFF tag.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.MetadataType
member.summary: Gets the tagged data type.
member.value: The tagged data type. Valid values are:

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the rendered page's width/height chosen by the user is approximated to the nearest cell's width/height to avoid clipping the Excel document's cell.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to ignore the margins when rendering a sheet or a page.

member.value: **true** to enable cutting the sheet into multiple pages moving from top to bottom, then left to right; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.summary: Creates a stamp image.
member.returns: The stamp image created by this method.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsExtensionList.GetAudioData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the embedded audio data from the specified extension list.
member.param: Index of the audio stream to retrieve. The extensions may have more than one audio stream. This index is 0-based. Therefore, the first stream is stream 0, the second stream is stream 1, etc. To retrieve all the audio streams, retrieve the streams one by one until an empty RasterNativeBuffer is returned (empty RasterNativeBuffer will have a RasterNativeBuffer.Data set to IntPtr.Zero and RasterNativeBuffer.Length set to 0.
member.returns: A RasterNativeBuffer object containing the audio data.

member.returns: The array of CodecsExtension objects containing the extension data.

member.summary: Releases all the resources used by this CodecsExtensionList.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000SaveOptions.AlphaChannelActiveBits
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the active bits for the alpha channel.
member.value: The active bits for the alpha channel. Possible values are 1 and 8. If the value is 1 it means the 256 levels of the 8-bit alpha channels will be transformed into two levels of value 255 or 0, using simple threshold. The threshold value is 127, so all values gt; 127 will be set to 255 and all values lt;= 127 will be set to 0. If the value is 8, all 256 levels of the 8-bit alpha channels will be compressed. This is the default value. This option should be used on a 32-bit bitmap: otherwise, it has no effect.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000SaveOptions.AlphaChannelLossless
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to save the alpha channel as lossless.
member.value: true to save the alpha channel as lossless; false, otherwise.

member.value: The compression control method.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides access to generic file load options.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Reset
member.summary: Resets this instance of CodecsLoadOptions to the default values.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.AllocateImage
member.summary: Enables or disables allocating memory for storing image data.
member.value: true to have LEADTOOLS do the necessary allocation, false to disable it.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.AllPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether RasterCodecs should try to load all the pages of a file by default.
member.value: **true** to load all the pages of a file by default; otherwise, **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.AutoDetectAlpha
member.summary: This property is no longer supported.
member.value: This property is no longer supported.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.AutoFixImageResolution
member.summary: Enables automatic resolution conversion of digital photos in LEADTOOLS.
member.value: **true** to automatically convert the resolution of digital photos in LEADTOOLS; **false** otherwise. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Comments
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether any comment fields found in the file should be automatically loaded.
member.value: **true** to automatically load any comment fields found in the file; otherwise it is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Compressed
member.summary: Enables or disables keeping the loaded image data compressed in memory.
member.value: true to keep loaded data compressed in memory.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Decrypt
member.summary: Provides options for loading any encrypted file.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.DiskMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use disk memory when loading an image.
member.value: true to load the image using disk memory; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.FixedPalette
member.summary: Enables or disables loading the image to the LEAD fixed palette.
member.value: true to force a palletized image to be dithered to the LEAD fixed palette.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the load format.
member.value: A RasterImageFormat enumeration value that specifies the load format.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.GeoKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether any TIFF Geo key tags found in the file should be automatically loaded.
member.value: **true** to automatically load any TIFF Geo key tags found in the file, otherwise; **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.IgnoreEmbeddedIccProfile
member.summary: Ignores the ICC profile embedded in the file.
member.value: **true** to ignore the ICC profile embedded in the file; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.InitAlpha
member.summary: Indicates whether to initialize the alpha channel when loading images as 32 or 64-bit.
member.value: true to set the alpha channel to ones (0xFF for 8-bit and OxFFFF for 16-bit), false to set the alpha channel to zeros.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.LoadCorrupted
member.summary: Indicates whether to load corrupted files without throwing an exception.
member.value: true to load corrupted files, false to throw an exception if the file cannot be completely loaded successfully.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Markers
member.summary: Enables or disables loading metadata markers during image file load.
member.value: true to enable loading metadata markers if present in the file, false to ignore them.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Name
member.summary: Indicates the optional name of the file to use as a hint when loading image data from memory streams.
member.value: The optional name of file to load. Default value is **null**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.NoDiskMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow disk memory when loading an image.
member.value: true to prevent loading the image using disk memory; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.NoInterlace
member.summary: Enables or disables loading files as interlaced.
member.value: When set to true, the Load methods pass image data in the order that is displayed, regardless of how it is stored in the file.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.NoTiledMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow tiled images.
member.value: true to prevent tiled image; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Passes
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of passes (scans through the image) when loading a progressive image (JPEG mainly).
member.value: The number of passes (scans through the image) when loading a progressive image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.PreferVector
member.summary: If this is set to true, SVG will be treated as Vector.
member.value: **true** to treat SVG files as vector; **false** otherwise.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.PremultiplyAlpha
member.summary: Indicates whether LEADTOOLS should premultiply the alpha values when loading the image data.
member.value: true to premultiply the alpha values when loading the image data, false to load the image data as it is stored in the file.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution (DPI).
member.value: The resolution (DPI).

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Rotated
member.summary: Indicates whether to load files without rotating them.
member.value: true to load files rotated, false to ignore the view perspective stored in the file.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Signed
member.summary: Indicates whether to load the image with negative pixel values.
member.value: true to load and keep negative pixel values, false to set negative pixel values to 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.StoreDataInImage
member.summary: Enables or disables the automatic storage of the image data into the RasterImage during a file load process.
member.value: true to have LEADTOOLS store the loaded image data into the RasterImage, false to disable it.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.SuperCompressed
member.summary: Enables or disables keeping the loaded image data compressed in memory.
member.value: true to keep loaded data compressed in memory.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.Tags
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether any tags found in the file should be automatically loaded.
member.value: **true** to automatically load any tags found in the file; otherwise it is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.TiledMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use tiled memory when loading an image.
member.value: true to load the image using tiled; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.UseNativeLoad
member.summary: This property is no longer supported.
member.value: This property is no longer supported.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.UseWriteableBitmap
member.summary: This property is no longer supported.
member.value: This property is no longer supported.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.XResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution (DPI).
member.value: The horizontal resolution (DPI).

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadOptions.YResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical resolution (DPI).
member.value: The vertical resolution (DPI).

member.summary: Creates an exact copy of the this CodecsLoadSvgOptions.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.AllowPolylineText
member.summary: (Deprecate) Indicates whether to allow replacing text with polyline shapes in the created SVG
member.value: **true** to allow replacing text with polyline shapes in the created SVG, otherwise; **fase**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.DropImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the image elements of the SVG should be dropped during load.
member.value: **true** if image elements of the SVG should be dropped during load, otherwise; **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.DropShapes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether any element that is not text or image in the SVG should be dropped during load.
member.value: **true** if any element that is not text or image in the SVG should be dropped during load, otherwise; **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.DropText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text elements of the SVG should be dropped during load.
member.value: **true** if text elements of the SVG should be dropped during load, otherwise; **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.ForceRealText
member.summary: Indicates whether to convert all text into text elements.
member.value: **true** to convert all text into text elements; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.ForceTextPath
member.summary: Indicates whether to replace all text by path elements..
member.value: **true** to replace all text by path elements; otherwise, **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.ForConversion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the created SVG should be optimized for conversion.
member.value: **true** if the created SVG should be optimized for conversion, otherwise; **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.IgnoreXmlParsingErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to try ignoring XML parsing errors when loading the SVG.
member.value: **true** to try ignoring XML parsing errors when loading the SVG, otherwise; **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadSvgOptions.MaximumElements
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum number of elements to load when loading an SVG.
member.value: A value that indicates the maximum number of elements to load when loading an SVG. Must be a value greater than or equal to 0. Use 0 to load all elements.

member.summary: Gets or sets the RasterImage object containing the loaded overlay image.
member.value: The RasterImage object containing the loaded overlay image. If the Info property of this CodecsOverlayData object is false, you need to load the overlay image into this property. Otherwise ignore. You do not need to call Dispose on this image. LEADTOOLS will dispose it for you once its done overlaying it on the image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsOverlayData.InfoWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay image width in pixels.
member.value: The overlay image width in pixels. If the Info property of this CodecsOverlayData object is true, you need to set this property to the overlay image width, otherwise, ignore.

member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay image horizontal resolution in pixels per inch.

member.summary: Gets or sets the overlay image vertical resolution in pixels per inch.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides options specifically for loading PDF, PS and EPS file options.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DetectTextDecoration
member.summary: Detects whether a line in a PDF file is to be converted to an underline or strikethrough text decoration.
member.value: **true** to automatically detect whether lines are underline or strikethrough text decorations; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **true**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DisableCieColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether CIE colors are disabled when loading PDF\*, PS or EPS files.
member.value: **true** to disable the use of CIE colors, **false** otherwise. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DisableCropping
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether to crop of PostScript (PS) and Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) files.
member.value: **true** to disable cropping of PostScript (PS) and Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) files, **false** otherwise. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DisplayDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the resulting raster image pixel depth.
member.value: The resulting raster image pixel depth, valid values are 0, 1, 4, 8, or 24. The default value is 0 for auto-detect.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DropImageOverText
member.summary: Indicates whether to drop the image over text (overlay) found on a page during load.
member.value: **true** to drop the image over text (overlay) found on a page during load; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.EnableInterpolate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use interpolation when loading PDF\*, PS or EPS files.
member.value: **true** to use interpolation when loading PDF, PS or EPS files, **false** otherwise. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.EnhanceThinLines
member.summary: Indicates whether to enhance thin lines when loading PDF files.
member.value: **true** to enhance thin lines when loading PDF files; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **true**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.GraphicsAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicate the type of graphics anti-aliasing to use.
member.value: The type of anti-aliasing to use. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.HideAllAnnotations
member.summary: (Deprecated) Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to hide all annotation objects.
member.value: **true** to hide all annotation objects, **false** show all annotation objects.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.HideAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to hide the annotation objects when loading a PDF page as a raster image or an SVG.
member.value: **true** to hide the annotation objects, otherwise; **false**. The default value is **true**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.HideDigitalSignatures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to hide the digital signature objects when loading a PDF page as a raster image or an SVG.
member.value: **true** to hide the digital signature objects, otherwise; **false**. The default value is **true**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.HideFormFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide the form fields when loading a PDF page as a raster image or an SVG.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.HideNoApAnnotations
member.summary: (Deprecated) Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to hide annotation objects that have no appearance stream.
member.value: **true** to hide annotation objects, **false** show annotation objects.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.LoadCorrupted
member.summary: Indicates whether to load corrupted files without throwing an exception.
member.value: **true**, to load corrupted files; **false**, to throw an exception if the file cannot be completely loaded successfully.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when loading encrypted PDF files.
member.value: The password to use when loading encrypted PDF files. Default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.TextAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicate the type of font anti-aliasing to use.
member.value: The type of anti-aliasing to use. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.UseLibFonts
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether to use the library installed fonts.
member.value: **true** to use the library installed fonts, **false** to use the system fonts. Default value is **true**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfLoadOptions.UsePdfEngine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to force using the LEADTOOLS PDF Engine (Leadtools.Pdf.Utilities.dll) when loading PDF files.
member.value: **true** to force using the LEADTOOLS PDF Engine (**Leadtools.Pdf.Utilities.dll**) when loading PDF files, otherwise; **false**. Default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfOptions.IsEngineInstalled
member.summary: Determines whether the LEADTOOLS PDF Engine Runtime files are installed.
member.value: **true** if the LEADTOOLS PDF Engine Runtime files are installed, **false** if they are missing.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions
member.summary: Provides options specifically for saving PDF images.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.AssembleDocument
member.summary: Enables or disables document assembly.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to add pages to or delete pages from the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.ExtractText
member.summary: Enables or disables text copying.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to extract text from the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.ExtractTextGraphics
member.summary: Enables or disables graphics copying.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to extract graphics from the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.FillForm
member.summary: Enables or disables form filling.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to fill in forms in the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.Linearized
member.summary: Creates a PDF document that is optimized for fast web viewing.
member.value: **true** to create a PDF document optimized for fast web viewing; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.LowMemoryUsage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use less memory when creating a PDF file with JPEG or Fax compression.
member.value: true to use less memory when creating a PDF file with JPEG or Fax compression; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.ModifyAnnotation
member.summary: Enables or disables annotation editing.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to edit annotations in the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.ModifyDocument
member.summary: Enables or disables editing.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to edit the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.OwnerPassword

member.value: The owner password to use when saving encrypted files.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.PrintDocument
member.summary: Enables or disables printing.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to print the document.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPdfSaveOptions.PrintFaithful
member.summary: Enables or disables high-quality printing.
member.value: true to give the user of the PDF document permission to print the document in high quality.

member.value: true to save the file as PDF/A; otherwise it will be saved as PDF.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions
member.summary: Contains set options for loading a document file as a raster image (rasterization).

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.BottomMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom margin value when rasterizing a document to a raster image.
member.value: A Double value that indicate the margin value in Unit to use when rasterizing a document to a raster image. Default value is **1.0** inches. The value of BottomMargin must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.LeftMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the left margin value when rasterizing a document to a raster image.
member.value: A Double value that indicates the margin value in Unit to use when rasterizing a document to a raster image. Default value is **1.25** inches. The value of LeftMargin must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the resulting raster image suggested height in Unit.
member.value: A Double value that indicate the resulting RasterImage suggested height in Unit. Default value is **11** inches. The value of PageHeight must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the resulting raster image suggested width in Unit.
member.value: A Double value that indicates the resulting RasterImage suggested width in Unit. Default value is **8.5** inches. The value of PageWidth must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution to use for rasterization document files.
member.value: An Int32 value that indicates the resolution to use for rasterization document files such as PDF and XPS. A value of 0 means to use the current screen resolution. The default value is 150.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.RightMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the right margin value when rasterizing a document to a raster image.
member.value: A Double value that indicates the margin value in Unit to use when rasterizing a document to a raster image. Default value is **1.25** inches. The value of RightMargin must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.SizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the transformation to use when converting the logical size specified in PageWidth and PageHeight to the final physical raster image size.
member.value: A CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode enumeration member that indicates the transformation to use when converting the logical size specified in PageWidth and PageHeight to the final physical raster image size. Default value is CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.None.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.TopMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the top margin value when rasterizing a document to a raster image.
member.value: A Double value that indicates the margin value in Unit to use when rasterizing a document to a raster image. Default value is **1.0** inches. The value of TopMargin must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.Unit
member.summary: Gets or sets the units to use for PageWidth, PageHeight, LeftMargin, TopMargin, RightMargin and BottomMargin values.
member.value: A CodecsRasterizeDocumentUnit enumeration member that specify the unit to use for PageWidth, PageHeight, LeftMargin, TopMargin, RightMargin and BottomMargin values. Default value is CodecsRasterizeDocumentUnit.Inch

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.XResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution to use when rasterization document files.
member.value: An Int32 value that indicates the horizontal resolution to use when rasterization occurs on document files such as PDF and XPS. A value of 0 means use the current screen resolution. The default value is 150.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.YResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical resolution to use for rasterization document files.
member.value: An Int32 value that indicates the vertical resolution to use for rasterization document files such as PDF and XPS. A value of 0 means to use the current screen resolution. The default value is 150.

member.summary: Indicates whether to use the full sheet when rasterizing or converting the sheet.

member.summary: Specifies whether to cut the sheet into multiple pages by moving from top to bottom first.
member.value: **true** to enable cutting the sheet into multiple pages moving from top to bottom, then left to right; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXlsLoadOptions.ShowHiddenSheet

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXpsSaveOptions.JpegQualityFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the JPEG quality factor used saving a raster image as an Open XML Paper Specification (XPS) document.
member.value: A value from 2 to 255, where 2 is the highest quality and 255 is the most compression. You can also use a factor of 0 to produce lossless JPEG compressed images. Default value is 2 (Highest quality).

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXpsSaveOptions.PngQualityFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the PNG quality factor used saving a raster image as an Open XML Paper Specification (XPS) document.
member.value: Any value between 0 and 10. 0 = (default compression), 1 (fastest compression) to 9 (highest compression ratio), 10 (no compression).

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.CommentsSupported(Leadtools.RasterImageFormat)
member.summary: Checks whether the given file format supports comment fields.
member.param: The RasterImageFormat to check
member.returns: This is a helper method that can be used to detect if a certain raster file format supports comment fields. For example, ReadComment and ReadComments can be used to read the comments stored in a file. If the file format supports comments, such as JPEG or EXIF, then these methods will successfully return the comments stored.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.CompactFile(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compacts TIFF/BigTIFF streams with default options.
member.param: A source Stream containing the data for the file being compacted. All the pages will be read from this stream.
A destination Stream that will contain the written data.
Value that represents the number of pages to copy. Use 0 to copy all the pages. If \pages\ is > 0, only \pages\ will be copied to \destStream\.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.CompactFile(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsSavePageMode,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compacts TIFF streams with specific options.
member.param: A Stream containing the data of the file being compacted. All the pages will be read from this stream.
A Stream that will contain the written data.
Value that represents the number of pages to copy. Use 0 to copy all the pages. If \pages\ is > 0, only \pages\ will be copied to \destStream\.
Specifies the start page in the source stream. Page 1 is the first page, page 2 is the second page, etc. The pages will be read starting with this page.
true to use \srcIfd\ as the stream offset of the first page. false to use \srcStartPage\.
Offset into the source stream for the start page. Used only if \useSrcIfd\ is true.
0 to overwrite \destStream\. <>0 to append the pages to the end of the stream.
true to use \destIfd\ as the stream offset of the first page. false to use \destStartPage\.
Offset into the destination stream for the start page. Used only if \useDestIfd\ is true.
Flag which indicates the save page mode.
true to have the **TGSUBFILETYPE** tag stripped from all pages in the destination file.

true to save pages in Motorola byte order. false to save pages in Intel byte order. This only applies when creating a new file. When updating existing files, the byte order of the original file is used.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.Convert(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,Leadtools.RasterImageFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsImageInfo)
member.summary: Converts an image stream from one format to another, creating a new image file in a stream in the new format.
member.param: A Stream containing the data of the input image file.
A Stream that will contain the data of the output image file.
The output file format. For valid values, refer to Summary of All Supported File Formats.
New width of the output image. If this value is not 0, then the output file will be resized to the \width\ value. Use a value of 0 if you do not wish to resize the output file.
New height of the output image. If this value is not 0, then the output file will be resized to the \height\ value. Use a value of 0 if you do not wish to resize the output file.
The output image pixel depth. Note that not all bits per pixel are available to all file formats.
A CodecsImageInfo object specifying more options for the conversion.

member.summary: Checks whether the given file format supports TIFF GeoKey tags
member.param: The RasterImageFormat to check
member.returns: This is a helper method that can be used to detect if a certain raster file format supports TIFF GeoKey tags. For example, ReadGeoKey, ReadGeoKeys and EnumGeoKeys can be used to read the GeoKeys stored in a file. If the file format supports GeoKeys, such as TIFF, then these methods will successfully return the GeoKey tags stored.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.GetOptimizedLoadData
member.summary: Gets the current optimized load data for the RasterCodecs object.
member.returns: A CodecsOptimizedLoadData object containing the current flat (unmanaged) optimized load data being used by this RasterCodecs object. The method can return **null** if the current `RasterCodecs` object is not using non-flat (unmanaged) optimized load data, or the last file format used did not support optimized load data.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.GetOptimizedLoadData(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the current optimized load data.
member.param: Set to **true** to get managed (flat) or unmanaged(non-flat) load data.
If the file format uses non-flat (unmanaged) load data:
For more information, refer to Using the OptimizedLoad Functions to Speed Loading Large Files.
member.returns: CodecsOptimizedLoadData object containing the current optimize load data being used by this RasterCodecs object or **null** if the current `RasterCodecs` object is not using optimize load, or the last file format used does not support it, or the optimized load data is not compatible with the **allowUnmanagedData** parameter.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.IsSvg(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Quickly determines whether the stream contains SVG data.
member.param: The stream containing the source image data.
member.returns: This method will check the beginning of the file to determine whether it contains valid SVG data. This involves detecting the value \<svg\> tag and optionally the SVG namespaces. If this method returns **true**, then the data is most likely an SVG file and can be safely loaded. Note, however, that the data can possibly contain a corrupted or truncated SVG. In such a case, this method will still return **true** but subsequent calls to loading the SVG will fail.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.IsSvg(System.String)
member.summary: Quickly determines whether the file contains SVG data.
member.param: The filename containing the source image data.
member.returns: This method will check the beginning of the file to determine whether it contains valid SVG data. This involves detecting the value \<svg\> tag and optionally the SVG namespaces. If this method returns **true**, then the data is most likely an SVG file and can be safely loaded. Note, however, that the data can possibly contain a corrupted or truncated SVG. In such a case, this method will still return **true** but subsequent calls to loading the SVG will fail.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.IsSvg(System.Uri)
member.summary: Quickly determines whether the URL contains SVG data.
member.param: The URL containing the source image data.
member.returns: This method will check the beginning of the file to determine whether it contains valid SVG data. This involves detecting the value \<svg\> tag and optionally the SVG namespaces. If this method returns **true**, then the data is most likely an SVG file and can be safely loaded. Note, however, that the data can possibly contain a corrupted or truncated SVG. In such a case, this method will still return **true** but subsequent calls to loading the SVG will fail.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.IsSvgAsync(this,Leadtools.ILeadStream)
member.summary: Asynchronously determines quickly whether the stream contains SVG data.
member.param: RasterCodecs object to perform the operation.
The stream containing the source image data.
member.returns: A `Task` that represents the asynchronous operation. `TResult`: **true** if the data is valid SVG; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.Load(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.Load(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads the specified image stream using specific options
member.param: A Stream containing the image data to load.
Resulting image pixel depth. Valid values are:

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images have no order. The following are valid values.
1-based index of the first page to load.
The 1-based index of the last page to load. Must be greater than or equal to \firstPage\. You can pass -1 to load from \firstPage\ to the last page in the stream.
member.returns: The RasterImage object that this method loads.

A LeadRect describing the tile/area of the image to load.
Resulting image pixel depth. Valid values are:

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images have no order. The following are valid values.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.Save(Leadtools.RasterImage,System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,Leadtools.RasterImageFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the specified image to a stream using an offset within to begin saving.
member.param: The RasterImage object that holds the image data.
A Stream where the image data will be saved.
The offset within the specified stream to embed the saved image file. For example, if you specify 5, then 5 bytes of other data will precede the embedded file.
The output file format. For valid values, Summary of All Supported File Formats.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Note that not all bits per pixel are available to all file formats. For valid values, refer to Summary of All Supported File Formats. If \bitsPerPixel\ is 0, the image will be stored using the closet bits/pixel value supported by that format. For example, if a file format supports 1, 4, and 24 bits/pixel, and RasterImage.BitsPerPixel is 5, the file will be stored as 24 bit. Likewise, if RasterImage.BitsPerPixel is 2, the file will be stored as 4 bit.
member.returns: The size of the embedded image file in bytes.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.Save(Leadtools.RasterImage,System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,Leadtools.RasterImageFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsSavePageMode)
member.summary: Saves the specified image to a stream using an offset within to begin saving.
member.param: The RasterImage object that holds the image data.

A stream where the image data will be saved. When saving to a stream, LEADTOOLS will not truncate the stream (if it already had a size/data). LEADTOOLS will reset the stream position to the original position before the save.
The offset within the specified stream to embed the saved image file. For example, if you specify 5, then 5 bytes of other data will precede the embedded file.
The output file format. For valid values, refer to Summary of All Supported File Formats.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Note that not all bits per pixel are available to all file formats. For valid values, refer to Summary of All Supported File Formats. If \bitsPerPixel\ is 0, the image will be stored using the closest bits/pixel value supported by that format. For example, if a file format supports 1, 4, and 24 bits/pixel, and RasterImage.BitsPerPixel is 5, the file will be stored as 24 bit. Likewise, if RasterImage.BitsPerPixel is 2, the file will be stored as 4 bit.
A 1-based index of the first page in the \image\ to save.
A 1-based index of the last page in the \image\ to save. Pass -1 to save all pages from the \firstPage\ to the last page in the \image\.
A 1-based index of the first output page. If the output file already exists, then this parameter lets you control which pages to overwrite and/or where to append the new pages.
Determines how to handle the page when saving to multipage formats. This can be one of the following:
member.returns: The size of the embedded image file, in bytes.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.Save(Leadtools.RasterImage,System.IO.Stream,Leadtools.RasterImageFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves a RasterImage to a stream in any of the supported compressed or uncompressed formats.
member.param: The RasterImage object that holds the image data.
A Stream where the image data will be saved.
The output file format. For valid values, Summary of All Supported File Formats.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Note that not all bits per pixel are available to all file formats. For valid values, refer to Summary of All Supported File Formats. If \bitsPerPixel\ is 0, the image will be stored using the closet bits/pixel value supported by that format. For example, if a file format supports 1, 4, and 24 bits/pixel, and RasterImage.BitsPerPixel is 5, the file will be stored as 24 bit. Likewise, if RasterImage.BitsPerPixel is 2, the file will be stored as 4 bit.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs.SavePsdWithLayers(Leadtools.RasterImage,System.String,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsPsdLayerInfo[])
member.summary: Saves an image to a PSD file, along with the specified layers.
member.param: The image to save.
The output file name.
Resulting file's pixel depth. For color images this can be 24 or 32. For grayscale images this can be 8.

An RasterImage object that contains layers (in each page) to save in the output file. The layers should have the same bits per pixel as the file. Every page in the image will be saved as a layer. The first page in the image will be interpreted as the first layer. The pages in the image must have the same bits per pixel as specified in \bitsPerPixel\.

An optional array of CodecsPsdLayerInfo objects. If this is a **null** reference , then each layer will start at (0, 0) and will have the same size as the image. If this is not a **null** reference, then the layer information for each layer in \layerInfos\ will be stored here.The number of CodecsPsdLayerInfo objects must be the same as the number of pages in \layerImages\.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RasterImageTypeConverter class.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.RasterImageTypeConverter.CanConvertFrom(ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether the converter can convert an object of the given type to an instance of RasterImage.
member.param: Type context information used to evaluate conversion.
The type of the source that is being evaluated for conversion.
member.returns: The CanConvertFrom method will return **true** if any of the supported object types is passed into the \sourceType\ parameter. However, this does not mean that the conversion operation will succeed, this depends on whether the data contains a valid image that LEADTOOLS can load. For more information, refer to RasterImageTypeConverter.

member.summary: Attempts to convert a specified object to an instance of RasterImage.

Cultural information that is respected during conversion.
The object being converted.
member.returns: A new instance of RasterImage.

The image being compressed bits/pixel value.

member.summary: Provides a callback method that gets called when loading a file containing an overlay.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTransformMarkerCallback
member.summary: Handles the processing of every JPEG marker present in the file transformed by RasterCodecs.Transform.
member.param: ID of the JPEG marker. The JPEG markers are uniquely identified by a byte value. Possible values are 1 to 254. (0 and 255 are not allowed.)

A pointer to the memory buffer containing the marker data. RasterNativeBuffer.Length contains the size in bytes of the JPEG marker. The size will be less than 65535. If this value is 0, then the marker does not have any extra data and \buffer\ should be ignored.
Flags that indicate the transform to be performed. These are the same flags passed to the RasterCodecs.Transform method.
member.returns: A CodecsTransformMarkerAction enumeration member that determines the action taken by the RasterCodecs after the callback is called. Possible values are:

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor
member.summary: Indicates the pre-defined quality factor for saving images using LEAD Advanced Bitonal Compression (ABC).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Lossless
member.summary: Lossless compression. This option compresses a 1-bit file and maintains image data unchanged. Highest quality.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.VirtualLossless
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option removes image noisy pixels and compresses it at a smaller file size than Lossless.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.RemoveBorder
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option removes image border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than VirtualLossless.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Enhance
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option cleans up the image, removes its border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than RemoveBorder.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified1
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option cleans up the image, removes its border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than Enhance. However, it may distort some text or straight lines.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified1Fast
member.summary: Same as Modified1 without the border remove or image clean processes.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified2
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option cleans up the image, removes its border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than Modified1. However, it may distort some text or straight lines. Maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified2Fast
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option compresses the image at a smaller file size than Modified1. However, it may distort some text or straight lines. Maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified3
member.summary: Lossy compression. Provides faster encode and decode speed than Modified1 or Modified2. if one exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than Modified1 or Modified2. Provides the maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified3Fast
member.summary: Same as Modified3 without the border remove or image clean processes.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.LosslessFast
member.summary: Faster lossless compression than Lossless. This option compresses a 1-bit file and maintains image data unchanged. Highest quality. Does not produce compression ratios as high as Lossless.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.LossyFast
member.summary: Lossy compression. This is the fastest ABC lossy compression option. Does not produce compression ratios as high as the other lossy options.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAnzView
member.summary: Indicates the view to use when loading ANZ (Analyze) images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAnzView.Transverse
member.summary: View is from underneath

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAnzView.Sagittal
member.summary: View is from right side

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAnzView.Coronal
member.summary: View is from front

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined
member.summary: Indicates the pre-defined quality factor for saving LEAD CMP compressed images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.Custom
member.summary: (MaximumCompression - 1)Custom Quality Factor.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.MaximumCompression
member.summary: This option gives maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.LessTiling
member.summary: This option produces less tiling in the image than the previous options. However, it may distort some text or straight lines.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.Sharp
member.summary: This option is recommended for images that have sharp edges. For example, an image that has a text overlay or an image with many straight lines.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.QualityAndSize
member.summary: This option provides the highest compression while maintaining good image quality.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.Quality
member.summary: While more colors are removed, most of them are colors or shades that are close to one another. The compressed image will appear very much like the original image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.SuperQuality
member.summary: This option removes colors not noticed by the human eye.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCmpQualityFactorPredefined.PerfectQuality1
member.summary: This option compresses all colors of a 24-bit file and maintains the quality of the original image at a smaller file size.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode
member.summary: The handling mode for a file codec.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode.Dynamic
member.summary: The codec is dynamically loaded and freed as necessary.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode.Fixed
member.summary: The codec is loaded into memory and will never be unloaded. (This makes the file handling very fast).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode.Ignored
member.summary: The codec is ignored. You cannot load, save or get the file information for any files normally handled by this codec.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsExtensionListFlags

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsExtensionListFlags.None
member.summary: No flags being used.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsExtensionListFlags.Stamp
member.summary: A stamp is present. Most likely suitable for LCD displays (and bigger than the stamp stored in the Exif data).The stamp can be loaded with CodecsExtensionList.CreateStamp.Note that this stamp is independent of the regular stamp present in Exif files. Some Exif files have two stamps. The regular stamp is loaded with RasterCodecs.ReadStamp, while the extension stamp is loaded with CodecsExtensionList.CreateStamp.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsExtensionListFlags.Audio
member.summary: Embedded audio data is present. The CodecsExtensionList.GetAudioData method can be called to get to the audio data.

member.summary: A precinct size of [X by X] will be applied to the first(smallest) resolution of the image. The second resolution precinct dimension would be [2X by 2X]. The third resolution precinct dimension would be [4X by 4X] and so on.

member.summary: A precinct size of [X by X] will be applied to the first and second (smallest) resolutions of the image. The third and fourth resolution precinct dimensions would be [2X by 2X] and so on.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000PrecinctSize.HierarchicalTwo512
member.summary: A precinct size of [X by X] will be applied to the first and second (smallest) resolutions of the image. The third and fourth resolution precinct dimensions would be [2X by 2X] and so on.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000ProgressionsOrder
member.summary: Indicates the order of progression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000ProgressionsOrder.LayerResolutionComponentPosition
member.summary: Quality axis order. Image starts out blurry and becomes clearer and more detailed as additional data is decoded.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000ProgressionsOrder.ResolutionLayerComponentPosition
member.summary: Resolution-axis order. Image starts out small and becomes larger as additional data is decoded. Higher compression ratios achieved by leaving lower resolutions in the file.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000ProgressionsOrder.ResolutionPositionComponentLayer
member.summary: Resolution-axis order. Image starts out small and becomes larger as additional data is decoded. Higher compression ratios achieved by leaving lower resolutions in the file.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000ProgressionsOrder.PositionComponentResolutionLayer
member.summary: Position axis order. Image starts out as a series of blocks starting from the top left corner. Additional portions of the image become visible as more data is decoded. Image data stored by spatial location.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000ProgressionsOrder.ComponentPositionResolutionLayer
member.summary: Color-axis order. Image starts out gray. Color is added as more data is decoded. Image data stored by color channel, starting with channel Y, then U, then V. If the transform to YUV option is used, the lowest decompressed image level for RGB is grayscale. Otherwise, the output is only the red channel.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000RegionOfInterest
member.summary: Indicates which region of interest to use.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000RegionOfInterest.UseLeadRegion
member.summary: Use the region stored in the RasterImage.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJpeg2000RegionOfInterest.UseOptionRectangle
member.summary: Use the region specified by RegionOfInterestRectangle.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder
member.summary: Indicates the desired byte order when loading image files.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.Rgb
member.summary: Red-green-blue order.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.Bgr
member.summary: Blue-green-red order.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.Gray
member.summary: 12 or 16-bit grayscale image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.RgbOrGray
member.summary: Load the image as red, green, blue OR as a 12 or 16-bit grayscale image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.BgrOrGray
member.summary: Load the image as blue, green, red OR as a 12 or 16-bit grayscale image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.Romm
member.summary: ROMM order. ROMM only supports 24 and 48-bit images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder.BgrOrGrayOrRomm
member.summary: Load the image as red, green, blue OR as a 12 or 16-bit grayscale image OR as ROMM. ROMM only supports 24 and 48-bit color images.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags
member.summary: Describes whether this is the first or last call of the event, and whether the buffer contains first or last row of image data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags.FirstPass
member.summary: This is the first pass through a progressive JPEG or CMP file.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags.LastPass
member.summary: This is the last pass through a progressive JPEG or CMP file.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags.FirstRow
member.summary: The first row of the buffer is the first row of the image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags.LastRow
member.summary: The last row of the buffer is the last row of the image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadImageFlags.Compressed
member.summary: The data in the buffer is 1-bit compressed data, which you can handle as explained in Speeding Up 1-Bit Documents.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsOverlayCallbackMode
member.summary: Indicates the overlay callback mode.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsOverlayCallbackMode.LoadCall
member.summary: First, try loading the overlay image from disk. If the load fails, the CodecsOverlayCallback method will be asked to provide the overlay image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsOverlayCallbackMode.CallLoad
member.summary: First, call the CodecsOverlayCallback method. If the handler did not supply an overlay image, try loading the overlay image from disk.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsOverlayCallbackMode.CallOnly
member.summary: Call the CodecsOverlayCallback method. If there is no CodecsOverlayCallback method passed, there is no overlay image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsOverlayCallbackMode.LoadOnly
member.summary: Try to load the overlay image from disk. If the load fails, there is no overlay.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies the transformation to use when converting the logical size specified in the current document rasterization options to the final physical raster image size.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.None
member.summary: Use the original document width and height. No transformation will be performed and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight are not used.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.Fit
member.summary: Fit the resulting raster image into CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight while maintaining the aspect ratio. If the original document size is smaller than the requested page size, no transformation is performed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.FitAlways
member.summary: Always fit the resulting raster image into CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight while maintaining the aspect ratio. If the original document size is smaller than the requested page size, then the result image is scaled up.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.FitWidth
member.summary: Fit the resulting raster image width into CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth while maintaining the aspect ratio. The image height will be calculated based on the transformation and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight is not used.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: The resulting raster image width and height will be exactly equal to CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight. Aspect ratio might be different than the original document.

member.summary: The page width, height or margins are in pixels.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentUnit.Inch
member.summary: The page width, height or margins are in inches.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentUnit.Millimeter
member.summary: The page width, height or margins are in millimeters.

member.summary: Overwrites the entire file. When saving to a Stream, LEADTOOLS will not truncate the stream (if it already had a size/data). LEADTOOLS will reset the stream position to the original position before the save.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsVectorViewMode
member.summary: Indicates the view mode for rasterizing a vector image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsVectorViewMode.UseBest
member.summary: Fit the drawing into the specified CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewWidth and CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewHeight. Final image size is less than or equal to the viewport size.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsVectorViewMode.UseWidthAndHeight
member.summary: Use the specified CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewWidth. Calculate new height, preserving the aspect ratio. Final image size has the same width as the current CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewWidth, with the height less than or equal to the current CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewHeight.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsVectorViewMode.UseWidth
member.summary: Use the current CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewHeight. Calculate the new width, preserving the aspect ratio. Final image size has the same height as the current CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewHeight, with the width less than or equal to the current CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewWidth.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsVectorViewMode.UseHeight
member.summary: Use both the CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewWidth and the CodecsVectorLoadOptions.ViewHeight (stretch image if necessary). Final image size has the same width and height as the current viewport size.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterPdfInfo

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the PDF page in pixels.
member.value: The height of the PDF page in pixels.

member.value: **true** if the PDF file was created with the support available in the LEADTOOLS PDF Pro, Pro Suite, Document or Medical products; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterPdfInfo.Resolution

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions
member.summary: Options used when loading a thumbnail from an image file.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color to use if both ForceSize and MaintainAspectRatio are true.
member.value: A RasterColor to use as the background color to use if both ForceSize and MaintainAspectRatio are true.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired thumbnail bits per pixel.
member.value: The desired thumbnail bits per pixel. The following are valid values:

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.Default
member.summary: Gets the default settings for CodecsThumbnailOptions.
member.value: The default settings for CodecsThumbnailOptions.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.DitheringMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the dithering method to use.
member.value: The dithering method to use.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.ForceSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether the generated thumbnail should be forced to the requested size, even if MaintainAspectRatio is set to true.
member.value: true to indicate that the thumbnail image will be generated by creating a "canvas" image with the requested size, and then centering the actual image inside that image. Note this is a slower process.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired thumbnail height in pixels.
member.value: The desired thumbnail height in pixels.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.LoadStamp
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether to attempt to load stamps from file formats that support preview images.
member.value: true to load the stamp from the file if present, false to ignore the stamp.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.MaintainAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether the aspect ratio of the image should be maintained when creating the thumbnail.
member.value: true to indicates that the aspect ratio of the image should be maintained when creating the thumbnail; false, otherwise.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired color order for the thumbnail image.
member.value: The desired color order for the thumbnail image.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.PaletteFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the palette flags to use.
member.value: The palette flags to use.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.Resample
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether to use interpolated resize when generating thumbnails.
member.value: true to use interpolated resize, false to use normal resize.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsThumbnailOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired thumbnail width in pixels.
member.value: The desired thumbnail width in pixels.
